title: Democratic Lawmakers Call for Investigation of Elon Musk’s Twitter
description: Seven Democratic senators urged the Federal Trade Commission to examine whether the social media company, under Mr. Musk’s ownership, had violated a 2011 privacy agreement.

title: Elizabeth Holmes to be Sentenced in Fraud Trial
description: Ms. Holmes, founder of the failed blood testing start-up Theranos, is scheduled to learn her fate on Friday. She faces a maximum of 20 years in prison.

title: Children’s Groups Want F.T.C. to Ban ‘Unfair’ Online Manipulation of Kids
description: Children’s privacy and health experts pressed regulators to prohibit video games and social networks from using attention-hacking techniques on youngsters.

title: Children’s Groups Want F.T.C. to Ban ‘Unfair’ Online Manipulation of Kids
description: Children’s privacy and health experts pressed regulators to prohibit video games and social networks from using attention-hacking techniques on youngsters.

title: New Chief Calls FTX’s Corporate Control a ‘Complete Failure’
description: “This situation is unprecedented,” said John J. Ray III, who helped manage Enron after its collapse in an accounting fraud scandal in 2001.

title: Meet Your New Corporate Office Mate: A ‘Brainless’ Robot
description: Naver, a South Korean internet firm, is trying to introduce robots into the world of cubicles and conference rooms without making employees uncomfortable.

title: SpaceX Employees Say They Were Fired for Speaking Up About Elon Musk
description: Charges filed with federal regulators accuse the company of retaliating against eight workers over an open letter critical of the chief executive.
